of lots on this sub, I took the job because I thought it would be a good experience and better than sitting on my ass at home

red_flags: perception that the job hunt and interview process is a oneway street, a tinder date with a really good looking girl who is way out of your league, it
want a shark to bite on your line if you are trying to catch fish, if you do hook a shark, then you probably want to cut the line asap
just take any job cause its at one of the FAANG companies, or because it pays good
want to take a job as a "splunk support engineer" for 2 years and after that when you need a job you only have been doing one thing that won't mean an
feel good or where you see anything that makes you have a hint of doubt about them
be scared, more interviews will come

process_insights.format: Mix of technical, behavioral, on-site, virtual
